revised_title: Improving the Voltaic Battery: Comparing Battery Designs and Acid Types
tldr: Michael Faraday investigates the practical construction and use of the voltaic battery, comparing different designs and acid types. He finds that a new battery design with paper insulation between copper plates performs better than the traditional design with porcelain or glass insulation. He also determines that nitric acid produces the highest voltaic action, with less zinc being dissolved per plate compared to other acids.
